label: Paragraphs 1
value: We have a steep driveway to a car park just off Bernard Street with limited parking.

label: Paragraphs 2
value: Overflow parking is available in the car park behind the flats at the top of the church grounds. From Bernard Street, turn onto Cricket Inn Road, then the first major right onto Maltravers Road, then right again onto St John's Street. Follow the road to the end of the car park and use the public footpath through the old churchyard to reach church.

label: Paragraphs 1
value: We have good public transport links. Hyde Park tram stop is right next to the church.

A community of Jesus-followers in Park, Sheffield.
We belong to the family of God,
love and serve our city,
and give Jesus praise in everything we do.
notes: HTML allowed. Keep links as text.

label: Desc
value: Your generosity helps sustain Sunday gatherings, midweek ministries, and practical support across our city.

label: Intro
value: Here is what makes a Sunday morning at St John's Park easy to step into.

label: Paragraphs 1
value: We gather to worship every Sunday morning at 10:45am. We also run activities during the week for children, local community support, and smaller groups.

label: Heading
value: What happens in a church service?

label: Paragraphs 1
value: The service is usually a little over an hour. We sing together, read the Bible, hear teaching that connects Scripture to everyday life, and spend time in prayer.

label: Paragraphs 2
value: On the first Sunday of each month, we also share Communion together.

label: Heading
value: What about children and young people?

label: Paragraphs 1
value: Children are very welcome. Most Sundays there is a children’s activity or children’s club during the service, and we work to help families feel at home.

label: Paragraphs 2
value: For more details, visit Park Kids and Park Youth.

label: Intro
value: Here is a step-by-step guide for what happens when visiting St John's Park Church on a Sunday.

label: Steps 1
value: When I arrive at St John's Park Church I will see a big blue open door with a ramp for wheelchair access.

label: Steps 2
value: I will go inside two sets of doors and then there will be someone at the back of church to say hello to me.

label: Steps 3
value: There will be ear defenders and activity bags for me to use if I want to. I am allowed to borrow them without asking.

label: Steps 4
value: The toilets are in the side hallway. There is also an accessible toilet and I am allowed to use it even if I don't have a disability.

label: Steps 5
value: In church I can sit on any of the available seats. If I have a wheelchair I am welcome to sit wherever I feel most comfortable.

label: Steps 6
value: When the service is ready to start, the person leading will say hello and tell us what is happening.

label: Steps 7
value: During the service we will sing songs. I can stand up or sit down to sing. It is OK to move around, dance or wave a flag.

label: Steps 8
value: After the Family Song, I will be invited to go into the side hall for kids activities. There is circle time, games, stories and a craft. It is OK to stay in the main service.

label: Steps 9
value: After the service I can stay for a drink and a biscuit and talk to people. If I don't want to do this, that is OK and I can go home with my family when we are ready.

label: Intro
value: We are a church family, and we need different people to help our family thrive. If you are part of St John's, we encourage you to join and serve one of our teams.

label: Outro html
value: Interested in joining a team? Please get in touch.
notes: HTML allowed. Keep links as text.

label: Description
value: Our welcome and hospitality team create the family environment we love at St John's Park. They welcome people at the door, serve refreshments, and make sure everyone receives a warm welcome.

label: Description
value: Our Kids team disciples the youngest generation in our church, from under-5s through primary-aged children.

label: Description
value: We disciple young people through Sunday Bible study and our midweek youth group Cornerstone, helping them meet and grow in relationship with Jesus.

label: Description
value: Our worship team helps us encounter God's presence and give him praise.

label: Description
value: Our Foodbank team serves local people in crisis, providing food parcels and a listening, friendly ear.

label: Description
value: Our lunch club team helps serve lunch and build relationships in this richly diverse, lively community.

label: Description
value: Our cleaning team enables us to welcome people into the building during the week and gather together on Sundays.

label: Description
value: Our car park team helps fit everyone in so we can gather together on a Sunday.

label: Description
value: Our creative team uses photography, social media, and video to show what God is doing locally and help people connect with church family.

label: Description
value: Our production team makes sure everyone can see and hear clearly during Sunday gatherings.

label: After service
value: Please join us for refreshments afterwards to hang out as church family.

label: Paragraphs 1
value: St John's is part of the Church of England in the Diocese of Sheffield. We are committed to being followers of Jesus who love and learn from God, support each other, and serve our community and beyond.

label: Paragraphs 2
value: Our faith is well summarized in the Apostles' Creed, shared by Christians around the world through the centuries.

label: Paragraphs 3
value: We believe in God the Father, in Jesus Christ his Son, and in the Holy Spirit; in forgiveness, resurrection, and eternal life in Christ.

label: Description
value: If you are in crisis, we can provide an emergency food parcel and practical support. Citizens Advice and Debt Support workers are available during sessions for those with referrals.
